title: CDA, Bulgaria pledge closer cooperation to boost urban development, bilateral ties
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 08 (APP):The Ambassador of Bulgaria to Pakistan, H.E. Irena Gancheva, met with Chairman Capital Development Authority (CDA), Chief Commissioner Islamabad, Muhammad Ali Randhawa, on Tuesday to explore avenues for deepening bilateral cooperation, particularly in the areas of urban development, environmental sustainability, and institutional collaboration.
The meeting, held at CDA Headquarters in Islamabad, took place in a cordial atmosphere and centered on strengthening ties between Bulgaria and Pakistan through shared priorities in city planning, beautification, and green development.
Ambassador Gancheva praised the CDA’s ongoing efforts to enhance the capital city’s infrastructure and environmental outlook under the leadership of Muhammad Ali Randhawa.
“I appreciate the significant strides Islamabad has made in urban beautification and environmental sustainability,” the Bulgarian envoy remarked. “Chairman Randhawa’s leadership in these areas is commendable and reflects a strong vision for a modern and green capital.”
In response, Chairman CDA Muhammad Ali Randhawa reaffirmed the authority’s dedication to transforming Islamabad into a model city.
“We are committed to making Islamabad more developed, beautiful, and environmentally sustainable,” Randhawa stated, while expressing appreciation for Bulgaria’s interest in fostering closer cooperation.
The meeting concluded with both sides expressing readiness to explore joint initiatives and share expertise, particularly in urban planning and environmental conservation.
Randhawa emphasized his country’s  commitment to deepening diplomatic and institutional ties with Bulgaria, while Ambassador Gancheva assured her government’s full support in advancing mutual collaboration.
